p: EEMLR and EEQGL at the dose of 500 mg/kg resulted in a crucial diminishment in the rectal temperature integrating with hyperthermia up to 3 h. The EEMLR lessened temperature in the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd hours from 102.03 °F to 96.93 °F, 96.96 °F, and 96.23 °F ( p < 0.05) independently, and triggered the highest temperature decline in the 3rd-hour corresponding to Brewer’s yeast induced hyperpyrexia method and EEQGL lower temperature from 101.23° F to 97.33 °F, 96.80 °F and 97.13 °F ( p < 0.05), respectively, in the 1st, 2nd and 3rd hours, causing higher temperature decline in the 2nd hour. Whereas, paracetamol recorded higher temperature depletion of 97.62 ± 0.34 in the 2nd hour. The results of the antipyretic assay are shown in Table 2.
